intro: Claytonia meyeniana, commonly known as the Sierra glacierweed, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Sierra Nevada and other mountain ranges in North America. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in late spring to early summer. Claytonia meyeniana is often found in meadows and along stream banks at elevations above 8,000 feet.
